name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Security and Privacy of Blockchain Technologies
base_name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Security and Privacy of Blockchain Technologies
long_desc: This course will cover the foundations of achieving and maintaining security and privacy while interacting with blockchain technologies such as cryptocurrencies, NonFungibleTokens, decentralized applications, and more. While millions of new users are signing up for decentralized platforms and billions of dollars are being invested, the importance of knowing the proper tools and techniques for guarding against possible attacks that compromise users security or privacy is crucial. Since in the case of decentralized applications there is no central authority in charge, the digital assets that are stolen can hardly be recovered. That is why people who are new to the crypto space often make irreversible mistakes that cost them a lot of money. Luckily, this course provides foundational knowledge for minimizing the risk of compromising privacy and security while interacting with applications built on blockchains. Students will be taught how to create crypto wallets, write smart contracts, deploy new cryptocurrencies, mint new NFTs, and more.

custom_fields.goals: By the end of the course, students should have a good understanding of the key concept involved in the Security and Privacy of Blockchain Technologies such as the history and fundamentals of Blockchain Technologies, the importance of high security of decentralized systems built on blockchain, the importance of privacy in the Web3 ecosystem and the ways of achieving and maintaining them in the long term. Students, at the end of the course, will also know how to create their own crypto wallets, write smart contracts, deploy new cryptocurrencies, and mint new NFTs NonFungibleTokens.
custom_fields.key_topics: Achieving and maintaining security and privacy of decentralized applications, various blockchain architectures, Cryptography, Cryptocurrencies, Mining, Staking, Smart Contracts, Decentralized Finance, Non-Fungible-Tokens, Metaverses, Decentralized Autonomous Organizations and Central Bank Digital Currencies.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Students will be assessed via attendance, assignments, quizzes and exams.
custom_fields.relevance: Nearly all modern software and networked systems are, or will be, exposed to attackers who attempt to subvert the system's intended goals and of course, blockchain technologies is no exception. When successful, such attacks can have devastating consequences for individuals, companies, and society in general. We have seen multiple instances of successful attacks on decentralized applications built on Blockchain, some of which have wiped out billions of dollars of cryptocurrencies in just a matter of hours. It has happened to Bitcoin, Ethereum, Cardano, and more recently Terra and is almost guaranteed to happen again to the old or new blockchains. As more and more money flows into the crypto ecosystem, the incentive for bad guys to attack the system goes us, hence the importance of having the fundamental knowledge of how to protect yourself from such attacks becomes more profound. This course will help students understand the threats they might face while interacting with decentralized applications on the blockchain, as well as the tools they can use to effectively defend themselves.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Students will have access to course web pages for information, Canvas for submissions and grade reports and Discord channel for communication.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: 30 hours outside of class work over the whole semester.
